summary: Expand VisaTrack beyond personal visa record tracking to also include a mock 'Australian Visa Check' screen where users can enter Application ID + email and view a custom status (not connected to government systems), with the user requesting removal of non-government/official guidance messaging from the UI.
architectural_notes: User requested removing the non-government disclaimer and official resource links from the website UI; review placement/content strategy accordingly.
User requested removing the 'Important Information' mock/disclaimer and official guidance content from the Australian Visa Check screen UI.
Australian Visa Check status entries may need extra fields (applicant name, visa type, status text) and a generated/displayed 'today' date on the result view.
Supporting PDF on approval results implies file storage/hosting strategy and access control tied to the status entry.
known_issues: Compliance/UX risk: removing the non-government disclaimer and official links could increase perceived affiliation with government services; confirm legal/compliance requirements before shipping.

Compliance/UX risk: implementing an 'Australian Visa Check' status screen (even as a mock) may increase perceived government affiliation; ensure clear disclosure and avoid implying access to official status systems.
Privacy/security risk: displaying/storing applicant name, email, and attached PDFs requires careful access control and data handling to prevent unintended disclosure.
Bug/regression: Australian Visa Check lookup by Application ID + Email is not returning/displaying the expected mock status entry (user reports nothing shows when submitting credentials).
Bug/regression persists after latest deploy (Draft Version 6): Australian Visa Check still shows blank / no result when submitting the expected Application ID + Email.
Bug/regression persists after Draft Version 8: Australian Visa Check still shows blank / no result (user reports "nothing is showing").

existing_features.title: Add Internet Identity sign-in and require authentication for any create/read/update/delete actions on stored visa records.
Create a dashboard UI that lets authenticated users add, view, edit, and delete their saved visa records with a clear, form-based workflow and validation (required fields, date validation).

Add reminder management for each visa record: allow users to set one or more reminder dates (e.g., 30/14/7 days before expiry or custom date) and show an in-app ‘Upcoming reminders’ section highlighting reminders due soon/overdue.

Include a clear non-government disclaimer and provide official links for users to check status via official portals (VEVO and ImmiAccount) without attempting to replicate or impersonate government services.
Establish a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) appropriate for a neutral personal tracker app, and apply it consistently across landing, auth, dashboard, and forms.
Generate and include simple custom static visuals for the app (logo and a minimal hero illustration) and render them from frontend static assets.
Remove the non-government disclaimer block and the 'Official Resources' (VEVO and ImmiAccount) links section from the site footer UI so that none of that content appears anywhere in the footer.
Remove the 'Official Government Resources' section from the landing page, including any buttons/links to VEVO and ImmiAccount, and remove the hero 'Check Official Status' external link button.
Create a new frontend page/screen labeled "Australian Visa Check" that lets a user enter Application ID and Email, submit, and view the returned custom status (or a clear "No status found" message).
Provide an authenticated management UI for custom statuses where signed-in users can create, edit, and delete status entries for (Application ID, Email) and set a user-defined status text.
Add navigation so users can reach the "Australian Visa Check" screen from the existing app UI without editing immutable hook/provider files.

Remove the 'Important Information' disclaimer block from the Australian Visa Status Check screen so that none of the following text appears anywhere on that page: 'Important Information', 'This is a mock visa status check system for demonstration purposes only', 'Status information is managed by authenticated users', and 'For official visa information, please contact the relevant government authorities'.

Extend the application status data model to support approval details by adding fields for applicant name, visa type, and an optional attached PDF (including PDF filename, content type, and binary bytes).

Update the Application Status Management UI to allow authenticated users to create/edit an application status with: Application ID, applicant email, applicant name, visa type, status text (e.g., 'Work visa approved'), and an optional PDF upload stored with the status entry.

Update the Australian Visa Check results view to display, when a matching status is found: applicant name, visa type, status text, and the current date (today’s date) as the approval date; and when a PDF attachment is present, show a clear 'View PDF' / 'Download PDF' action that opens or downloads the attached PDF.

Make Application ID and applicant email matching resilient to common user input differences by normalizing lookup and storage keys consistently (trim whitespace; treat applicant email case-insensitively) across backend create/update, delete, and lookup paths for application statuses.

Update the Australian Visa Check page UI to distinguish between “no matching status found” and a real request failure (e.g., backend trap or network error), and show a clear error message when the check request fails.
Fix the Australian Visa Check flow so submitting an Application ID + Applicant Email always results in a visible outcome (found result, “no status found”, or an error), rather than appearing blank.

Ensure the frontend correctly interprets the backend response shape for `getApplicationStatus` (Motoko optional) and converts it into the page’s expected `ApplicationStatus | null` result type before rendering.

Add a small developer-facing diagnostic (console logging is acceptable) to help distinguish whether the blank outcome is caused by (a) request never firing, (b) request error, or (c) unexpected response shape, without changing any user-facing copy beyond existing error messaging.

Update the Australian Visa Status Check approval/result UI so that when a matching application status is found and it contains a PDF attachment, the PDF can be displayed directly on the approval result screen (inline embedded viewer), in addition to the existing View/Download actions.

Fix the Australian Visa Status Check flow so that after submitting an Application ID and Applicant Email, the page always renders a visible outcome (found result, “No status found…”, or an error message) and never appears blank to the user.

Ensure unauthenticated users can successfully run the Australian Visa Status Check against the backend and receive the built-in demo status for Application ID "4906670766" and applicant email "jr321134@gmail.com" (including correct normalization behavior for trimming whitespace and case-insensitive email).

Add a user-visible fallback for unexpected runtime/render failures so the app does not show a completely blank screen; display an English error message with a simple retry instruction and log the underlying error to the console for debugging.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a non-government visa helper app for users to store their own visa details (expiry date, notes) and manage reminders.

Implement backend data model and APIs to store a user’s visa records including: visa label/name, visa grant number/reference (optional), visa expiry date, conditions/notes (free text), and created/updated timestamps.
Remove the non-government disclaimer and the 'Official Resources' links (VEVO, ImmiAccount) section from the website UI.
Add an 'Australian Visa Check' screen that accepts Application ID and email and shows a user-defined custom status per Application ID (mock/non-government; no real government integration).

Add backend support for a mock Australian visa application status registry keyed by (Application ID, Email) where authenticated users can create, update, list, and delete custom status entries (no integration with any external/government systems).
Add a backend query method that allows checking the stored custom status by providing Application ID and Email, returning the matching entry (or null if none exists).
Remove the 'Important Information' / mock non-government disclaimer and official guidance text from the Australian Visa Check screen UI.

Extend the Australian Visa Check result to display additional fields for a matched entry: applicant name, visa type, approval status text (e.g., 'Work visa approved'), and the current date on the approval view.
Add support for attaching a PDF to a custom status entry and displaying/downloading that PDF on the Australian Visa Check approval/result screen.
Create a specific mock status entry that can be found by Application ID + Email (e.g., 4906670766 + jr321134@gmail.com) showing applicant name 'Rojee Sharma' and status 'Work visa approved'.

Create a specific mock status entry that can be found using Application ID '4906670766' and applicant email 'jr321134@gmail.com', with applicant name 'Rojee Sharma' and status text 'Work visa approved'.

Update the backend `getApplicationStatus(applicationId, applicantEmail)` query so that unauthenticated callers do not hit an authorization trap and can still receive the built-in demo status for Application ID `4906670766` and email `jr321134@gmail.com`, while ensuring unauthenticated callers cannot read any user-created application statuses.
